item.title: The Man Who Survived 76 Days Alone at Sea Despite Shark Attacks
item.description: In 1982, sailor Steven Callahan survived 76 days adrift in the Atlantic after his yacht sank. Facing storms, hunger, and sharks, his incredible survival story became world famous.

media:content.media:title: The Man Who Survived 76 Days Alone at Sea Despite Shark Attacks
media:content.media:description: In 1982, sailor Steven Callahan survived 76 days adrift in the Atlantic after his yacht sank. Facing storms, hunger, and sharks, his incredible survival story became world famous.

item.title: Was Diana's Passing Really an Accident?
item.description: In 1997, Princess Diana died following a car crash in Paris, sparking worldwide grief. Decades later, her death remains one of the most discussed royal tragedies in modern history.

item.title: The Denise Amber Lee Abduction Case
item.description: In 2008, Denise Amber Lee was abducted in Florida and managed to call 911. Despite multiple emergency calls, she wasn’t rescued. Her case later spurred major reforms in 911 training and response.

item.title: Richard Hoagland: Missing 23 Years, Then Found
item.description: He Was Found 23 Years Later: Richard Hoagland

item.title: The Death of Ellen Rae Greenberg
item.description: Parents Against The Justice System. The Ellen Rae Greenberg Case

item.title: Wife Killed on Fiji Honeymoon
item.description: She Never Made It Back From Their Dream Honeymoon in Fiji

item.title: Could the Titan Sub Disaster Have Been Prevented?
item.description: n June 2023, OceanGate’s Titan submersible imploded during a dive to the Titanic wreck, killing five. The disaster raised serious questions about safety warnings that went unheeded.

item.title: The Case of Jacob Landin’s Death
item.description: In 1987, 9-month-old Jacob Landin died under suspicious circumstances. Decades later, his brother Eric joins the discussion, sharing his fight to uncover the truth and push for justice

item.title: Last Seen On CCTV Acting Bizarre & Then He Suspiciously Vanished
item.description: In 1996, 16-year-old Damien Nettles vanished on the Isle of Wight after being seen on CCTV acting strangely. Despite decades of searches, his case remains unsolved and his family seeks answers.

item.title: From Harry Potter Obsession to Cult Leader With Unchecked Power
item.description: In 2012, Bethany Deaton was found dead in Kansas City. At first ruled a suicide, her case drew suspicion when members of her religious community came under scrutiny. Her death remains controversial.

item.title: The Brutal Case of Brittany McGlone Remains Unsolved
item.description: In 2007, 19-year-old Brittany McGlone was found murdered in her boyfriend’s home in Texas. Despite multiple suspects and years of investigation, her case remains unsolved.

item.title: The Tragic Amanda Blackburn Case
item.description: In 2015, Amanda Blackburn, a young mother and pastor’s wife, was murdered during a home invasion in Indianapolis. Larry Taylor Jr. was later convicted and sentenced to 86 years in prison.

item.title: The Hannah Pettey Lead Poisoning Case
item.description: Hannah Pettey was slowly poisoned with lead by her mother, leading to severe illness. She ultimately survived, and the case exposed a disturbing act of abuse within her own family.

item.title: Who Was Involved In Alexis Sharkey’s Disappearance?
item.description: In 2020, 26-year-old influencer Alexis Sharkey was found dead in Houston. Police later determined her husband, Tom Sharkey, was responsible, but he died by suicide before facing trial.

item.title: Christopher Langan: The “Smartest Man Alive”
item.description: Often called “the smartest man in America,” Christopher Langan has claimed an IQ up to 210. But questions remain about the accuracy of his test results and the mythology around his intellect.

item.title: The Kayak Death of Vincent Viafore
item.description: In 2015, Angelika Graswald was accused of tampering with her fiancé Vincent Viafore’s kayak on the Hudson River, leading to his drowning. She later pleaded guilty to negligent homicide and was released in 2017.

item.title: She Called 911 Mid Abduction and They Didn't Save Her
item.description: In 2008, Denise Amber Lee was abducted in Florida and managed to call 911. Despite multiple emergency calls, she was not rescued. Her murder later spurred major reforms in 911 training and response.

item.title: Haley Anderson: Killed by a Fellow Student
item.description: Fellow Peer Ends Nursing Student's Life For Breaking Things Off

item.title: Paranoid or Targeted? The Mystery Surrounding Blair Adams
item.description: In 1996, Canadian Blair Adams left home suddenly and drove across the U.S. Days later, he was found murdered in Tennessee, surrounded by cash and valuables. His case remains unsolved.

item.title: He was Sentenced to LIFE at only 11 YEARS OLD! What happened to Jordan Brown?
item.description: In 2009, 11-year-old Jordan Brown was convicted of killing his father’s fiancée and sentenced to life. After years of appeals, the conviction was overturned in 2018, and he was released.
